intro: Senecio quezalticus, commonly known as the Quezaltic groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio quezalticus is often found in elevations above 2,000 meters, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
